summary: This bill, the Providing Empathetic and Effective Recovery Support Act (PEER Support Act), addresses behavioral health workforce shortages by supporting peer support specialists. It defines peer support specialists, mandates the revision of the Standard Occupational Classification system to include them, establishes an Office of Recovery within the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA), and directs research and recommendations on criminal background check processes for peer support specialists, aiming to reduce barriers to certification and practice. The bill promotes access to recovery support services by developing support for peer support specialists.
